p: Within the wood category, most of the plants were used to obtain firewood (19 spp.), followed by species to make fences (11), house construction (8), and tools (5). The wood of Myrsine dependens, known as “cucharo,” was used to make spoons to stir hot chocolate (Fig. 4). Currently, the manufacture of wooden spoons is nearly abandoned, just like the thatching of roofs with Calamagrostis effusa (Fig. 4), Agrostis boyacensis, or Cyperus luzulae. Other lost plant practices include the building of walls with Espeletia spp. (Fig. 4) and the making of beds with the lily Orthrosanthus chimboracensis.
